ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: A colour picker that can be used as an input in Shiny apps or Rmarkdown documents. The colour picker supports alpha opacity, custom colour palettes, and many more options. A Plot Colour Helper tool is available as an RStudio Addin, which helps you pick colours to use in your plots. A more generic Colour Picker RStudio Addin is also provided to let  you select colours to use in your R code.

A colour picker that can be used as an input in Shiny apps or Rmarkdown documents. The colour picker supports alpha opacity, custom colour palettes, and many more options. A Plot Colour Helper tool is available as an RStudio Addin, which helps you pick colours to use in your plots. A more generic Colour Picker RStudio Addin is also provided to let  you select colours to use in your R code.

name: r-colourpicker
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "1.3.0" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-colourpicker
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/colourpicker_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/colourpicker/colourpicker_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: c7f2618cd1ae1f7ac15aee072c648e6494dfff6714e13dc7cd1da993d1102510

build:
  number: 2
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-htmltools
    - r-htmlwidgets >=0.7
    - r-jsonlite
    - r-miniui >=0.1.1
    - r-shiny >=0.11.1
    - r-shinyjs >=2.0.0
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-htmltools
    - r-htmlwidgets >=0.7
    - r-jsonlite
    - r-miniui >=0.1.1
    - r-shiny >=0.11.1
    - r-shinyjs >=2.0.0

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('colourpicker')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('colourpicker')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/daattali/colourpicker
  license: MIT
  summary: A colour picker that can be used as an input in Shiny apps or Rmarkdown documents. The colour picker supports alpha opacity, custom colour palettes, and many more options. A Plot Colour Helper tool is available as an RStudio Addin, which helps you pick colours to use in your plots. A more generic Colour Picker
    RStudio Addin is also provided to let  you select colours to use in your R code.
  license_family: MIT
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - MathiasHaudgaard
    - FrodePedersen
    - ArneKr
